title: S&P/ASX 200 rises to 11-month high of 6,900 as big miners and banks rise
text: S&P/ASX 200 (INDEXASX:XJO) has hit a new 11-month high today with the index touching 6,900 points at about 1.45 pm, its best level since February 2020. This follows a surge on Wall Street on Friday to new highs amid strong corporate earnings, stimulus hopes and the rollout of the COVID-19 vaccine.

title: Game Over?
text: Market observers and participants have been temporarily distracted in the past week by the battle between Reddit's plucky retail investors and lazy short-selling hedge funds over the fate of GameStop. People with time on their hands, and a stimulus cheque(?), have decided to take a punt.

title: Q4 GDP: Five Feet High And Rising
text: The most important economic issue post-pandemic will be what happens to the flood of household cash that has accumulated in high income households. The pandemic has taken money out of the economy and put it into a range of assets as diverse as stocks, bitcoin and residential real estate.

title: There Is No Bubble
text: In the first part of this article, I explain there is certainly one kind of bubble that investors are seeing and feeling right now. In the second part, I open up the realm of possibility while also discussing growth versus value investing.

title: The Week Ahead: Bulls Are Charging Despite Bubble Fears
text: The bulls were in charge all week as many traders are expecting more stimulus and improving news on vaccines. The Viper Report's Tom Aspray sees a higher risk profile now than when the advance/decline lines broke out last November.

title: Stock futures higher following best week since November
text: U.S. stock index futures advanced in overnight trading following Sunday's record-setting session.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Elliott Management considering creating a SPAC
text: Elliott Management Corp., the hedge fund best known for its high-profile shareholder-activist campaigns, is looking to join the sizzling SPAC craze.

title: Reddit rebellion is a sign of 'irrational exuberance,' but market bull Ed Yardeni suggests it's different this time
text: Yardeni Research's Ed Yardeni finds market enthusiasm resembles the dot-com bubble, but says it's too early to turn bearish.

title: Weak Jobs Report Makes a Strong Case for More Stimulus
text: The U.S. economy created very few new jobs in January, making it more likely that both the Federal Reserve and the federal government will boost economic stimulus already underway.

title: Yellen says Biden economic plan could achieve full employment in U.S. in 2022
text: Yellen says Biden economic plan could achieve full employment in U.S. in 2022

title: Despite Weaker Economic Data, The Markets Continue To Advance (Technically Speaking For The Week Of 2/1-2/5)
text: Most long-leading and leading indicators are positive. There continues to be weakness in the coincidental indicators.

title: FTSE 100 ends just below the flatline; Wall Street, including GameStop, having more success
text: FTSE 100 index down 14 points US stocks mostly higher, including GameStop Big tech stocks in the red US jobs data undershoots estimates 5pm: FTSE 100 slips back into the red London's leading index ended Friday down 14 points, 0.2%, at 6,489. The FTSE 250, meanwhile, gained 257 points, 1.2%, to 21,067.

title: Wall Street follows worst week since October with best week since November
text: 4 pm: News that Democrats passed a budget resolution seems to have been well received The Dow closed Tuesday up 92 points, 0.3%, at 31,148, rounding out the index's best week since November, per CNBC. The Nasdaq Composite gained 79 points, 0.6%, to 13,856, and the S&P 500 picked up 15 points, 0.4%, to end the day at 3,887.

title: Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq advanced as investors remain optimistic about a stimulus package
text: The U.S. stock market advanced in the first trading week of February, and Wall Street's three main indexes surged, boosted by optimism over corporate earnings, stimulus talks, and progress on vaccine rollouts. As more people get vaccinated, economic activities will start to recover while the further stimulus expectations also helped improve the market sentiment.

title: Retail, Rent And Things That Don't Scale
text: I generally think about retail as sitting on a spectrum from logistics to experience. E-commerce began at the logistics end, as a new and (sometimes) more efficient way to get something.

title: No, the Super Bowl Winner Doesn't Predict Anything for the Stock Market
text: There is nothing to fear for investors—even if Patrick Mahomes' Kansas City Chiefs beat Tom Brady's Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

title: Wall Street Wins Again As GameStop Becomes Game Over
text: While the money flow "buy signal" will likely trigger next week, the market is already trading 2-standard deviations above the 40-dma. Such suggests that the upside may be more limited over the next couple of weeks.

title: Yellen says U.S. could return to full employment next year if Covid relief passes
text: The U.S. could return to full employment in 2022 if President Biden's Covid stimulus package is passed, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said Sunday.

title: ‘We're In A Deep Hole': Yellen Warns Unemployment Will Stay Elevated For Years Without Stimulus
text: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen predicted that the U.S. could return to full employment by next year if Biden's stimulus package passes.

title: Yellen: Too soon to say if new regulations needed to address recent volatility
text: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Sunday that it is too soon to say whether new policies or regulations are needed to deal with recent market volatility.

title: Negative interest rates and huge deficits are the new normal. What comes next?
text: The pandemic is pushing economic policy to the limits. Governments around the world are running record budget deficits, and central banks are becoming addicted to easy money policies that would have been unthinkable two decades ago.

title: The global chip shortage is hurting businesses and could be a national security issue. Here are 9 quotes that help explain what that means for the market.
text: Semiconductors are a critical part of the modern world. They're used in everything from iPhones to fighter jets, and without them, much of the technology that makes daily life possible in 2021 simply wouldn't be able to exist. Every time you step into a car or send an email, you're using semiconductors. So, when the global supply of these precious chips begins to wane, it can be a big problem.

title: China Turns Semiconductors Into The ‘New Oil' While GM Runs Out Of Chips
text: Taiwan and South Korea are the “new OPEC”, with China building and being the demand driver.

title: Fundstrat's Tom Lee pinpoints the single most important indicator signaling strong economic growth — and details his stock-market strategy for taking advantage
text: The economic recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic remains on shaky ground, as evidenced by Friday's weaker-than-expected January jobs report. The US added just 49,000 jobs in January, well below the estimate for 105,000 new jobs. But despite the miss, investors shouldn't be too concerned about the ongoing economic recovery, Fundstrat's Tom Lee said in a note on Friday.

title: Goldman Sachs says the reflation trade is on and these 5 market dynamics that could 'shift materially' as price pressures build
text: Inflation is heating up for the first time in a long time which should largely boost equities, but could have a sting in its tail for those who ignore the changes it could bring. After 2020's 'event-driven' recession, there is a bull market underway across equities and the psychology behind it is one in which investors are moving out of the "hope" phase into the longer "growth" phase, according to Goldman Sachs, and this suggests "a possible inflection point towards a more reflationary environment."

title: Weekly Commentary: That's On Them
text: The S&P 500 surged 4.6% (up 3.5% y-t-d), and the Dow rose 3.9% (up 1.8%). Three-month Treasury bill rates ended the week at 0.02%.

title: Many Malls Are A Pandemic Away From Extinction
text: Several subscribers have reached out to us for updates on these two volatile stocks. We recently took profits on Tanger and upgraded Macerich to a Strong Speculative Buy.

title: Our Biggest Equity REIT Position
text: Some of the best managed REITs have efficiently issued new equity at premium valuations. They use the cash to continue growing the portfolio in a manner that drives further returns for existing shareholders.
